item.title: Vinay Rajani of HDFC Securities suggests these stocks to buy for short-term

review.headline_rewrite: Vinay Rajani of HDFC Securities suggests these stocks to buy for short-term

Investors felt encouraged by an unexpectedly strong gross domestic product (GDP) growth of 7.8% for the April-June quarter.
Market analysts observed that the favourable GDP figures, along with a recent US court decision declaring Trump's tariffs unconstitutional, bolstered investor sentiment.

item.title: Nifty Bank loses 6.4% in two months — What ails banking stocks?

review.headline_rewrite: Nifty Bank loses 6.4% in two months — What ails banking stocks?
bullets: The underperformance of banking heavyweights also dragged down the benchmark indices, sending Nifty 50 and Sensex lower by 1.3% and 1.8%, respectively, in August.
The bleed in domestic-focused stocks was largely driven by weakness in the bond market, as prices in recent weeks have worsened, leading to a
The yield on the Indian 10-year G-Sec rose toward 6.6% in August, its highest level since March 27, as fiscal worries and muted demand

item.title: CG Power shares jump 3.56% as investors cheer India’s first OSAT facility launch

review.headline_rewrite: CG Power shares jump 3.56% as investors cheer India’s first OSAT facility launch
bullets: The facility launch has drawn significant analyst attention, with Morgan Stanley initiating coverage on CG Power with an ‘Overweight’ rating and target price of
Morgan Stanley projects strong growth for CG Power’s segments, forecasting 14 per cent revenue CAGR for industrials and 35 per cent for power systems
CG Semi, a joint venture with Renesas Electronics and Stars Microelectronics, will serve automotive, defense, infrastructure and IoT applications.

item.title: Greenzo Energy wins green hydrogen plant order from Jindal Stainless

review.headline_rewrite: Greenzo Energy wins green hydrogen plant order from Jindal Stainless
bullets: Greenzo Energy India Limited has secured an order from Jindal Stainless Limited (JSL) to supply and commission a green hydrogen electrolyser plant at JSL’s
The plant will have a designed capacity of 472,409 kg per year and is scheduled for delivery within six months of contract signing.
The electrolyser system features indigenous alkaline bipolar technology delivering hydrogen at 30 bar pressure with 99.99999 per cent purity.
